name: CarbonChain
slogan: Solving provenance in supply chains using blockchain
description:
We are a blockchain startup solving the authenticity and provenance problems in supply chains using distributed ledger technology. We are building a technology platform to solve the problems of trust and transparency in supply chains and make them more efficient and secure. Our blockchain technology powered platform will transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.

With our platform we aim to disrupt the $3b+ blockchain supply chain industry making our partners across food & beverage and industrial minerals compliant, efficient and more cost effective.

jobs.title: Full Stack Blockchain Developer
jobs.description:
A bit about us @ carbonchain.io
We are a blockchain startup solving the authenticity and provenance problems in supply chains using distributed ledger technology. We are building a technology platform to solve the problems of trust and transparency in supply chains and make them more efficient and secure. Our blockchain technology powered platform will transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers. 

We have assembled a strong team with deep expertise in supply chain and logistics, technology and and business development from Amazon, BCG and Goldman Sachs. We were part of the LBS Incubator and have recently closed funding from UK government to further develop our platform. You will be working with the team from day one and will gather valuable experience in being part of a business from its earliest stages.

We have already built the first version of our platform and now we are looking to hire a full stack blockchain developer to join our jedi force to build the next stage of the CarbonChain platform as we are scaling to build partnerships with industry players in the supply chain space.

What you will do:
You will be working with the product and business development teams to develop our smart contracts on Ethereum. You will be responsible for our backend APIs in Python. Initially, you will join the team on a 3-month contract basis with an option to extend and even join full time.

You will bring the following technical skills:
Core blockchain concepts and if you are not yet fully proficient, you should be willing to dive deep down the rabbit hole. Therefore, it would be great if you have some experience / awareness of Ethereum, Solidity, Truffle, Zeppelin, Infura, Geth, Parity, Quorum, or other blockchain platforms and technologies.
Coding. As a Full Stack Developer, we’re looking for proven expertise in Python, and React.JS. You should be up to speed on practices like TDD and continuous integration.
Collaboration. You would have some experience collaborating on software projects with design and backend teams. You will have experience working in an agile approach.
Cloud deployments. Experience building for deployments to AWS using Docker
Prototyping and PoCs. You'll have experience of building prototypes for different use cases, and won't get too worried if needs and priorities change i.e. that they don't end up being implemented.

Soft Skills
Be caring. You'll enjoy working together with the rest of the team so we all learn from each other, especially in such a rapidly changing space.
Be ambitious. You’ll need a startup mentality, and will revel in rapidly pivot between different projects, priorities and contexts. 
Be flexible. Your role as a Full Stack Developer won't be set in stone, so it's vital that you enjoy change and you're willing to experience new ways of thinking. 
Sense of humour is a definite plus!

What we offer:
Be part of our journey to disrupt the $3b+ blockchain supply chain market
An opportunity to develop your blockchain programming skills in a flexible working environment developing real solutions for our B2B clients.
You will be one of the earliest member of the tech team hence, you will have the option to lead future platform development as we go along in our journey.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
We are looking to hire a hands on product manager - our first Jedi knight! 

This position requires a combination of product management, process optimisation, and execution capabilities. You love solving problems and partnering, and will be working on many different types of problems and challenges from day one.

You might be supporting the founders with pitch decks, figuring out requirements with a global customer one day and helping out with a new pilot project the next. You are the first responder when things go wrong and will be expected to craft and implement processes to reduce friction and enable all team members to spend their time on what they do best. 

You will need to enjoy being hands on - this role isn't for you if you're someone who likes to manage by RAG statuses, calls and powerpoint! The role will demand that you think creatively, work collaboratively, and do whatever it takes to get the job done. 

Required Jedi skills: 
• Hands on PM experience in an agile delivery environment 
• Excellent verbal and written communication in English 
• Ability to work in a fast paced, nimble technology environment and be comfortable with ambiguity 
• Ability to organise, plan and set expectations proactively
• Attention to detail - requirements, timelines, cost, people, decisions and actions. 
• Have worked in a startup as well as in a big corporate environment 
• Self-starter, you run quickly with little supervision and operate with a sense of urgency in executing and delivering

Bonus points for: 
• Blockchain/DLT project implementation experience - ideally Ethereum based. 
• Experience acting as the interface between technical development teams and client business leads, including proposal writing, functional requirements gathering, user stories, and presentation to senior client stakeholders

jobs.title: UI/UX Design
jobs.description:
JD: UI / UX Design

A bit about us @ carbonchain.io
We are a blockchain startup solving the authenticity and provenance problems in supply chains using distributed ledger technology. We are building a technology platform to solve the problems of trust and transparency in supply chains and make them more efficient and secure. Our blockchain technology powered platform will transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.

We have assembled a strong team with deep expertise in supply chain and logistics, technology and and business development from Amazon, BCG and Goldman Sachs. We were part of the LBS Incubator and have recently closed funding from UK government to further develop our platform. You will be working with the team from day one and will gather valuable experience in being part of a business from its earliest stages.

We have already built the first version of our platform and now we are looking to hire a UI/UX designer to join our jedi force to build the next stage of the CarbonChain platform as we are scaling to build partnerships with industry players in the supply chain space.

What you will do:
You will be working closely with the product and business development team to design simple and elegant flows. You will create design artefacts like mockups, wireframes, interactive prototypes, and marketing collateral. Initially, you will join the team on a 3-month contract basis with an option to extend and even join full time.

You will bring the following skills:
Strong design skills across iOS, Android and web platforms
The ability to think at a high level about product strategy
Excellent communication skills to clearly articulate design decisions and experience working closely with engineers
Experience working in agile approach
The ability to take ownership of design process and work as self-directed member of the development team
Broad knowledge of design tools such as Photoshop, AI, Sketch, Invision
Strong, clean visual design sense and strong skills in typography and grids
Must have a portfolio featuring examples of product design work

Soft Skills
Be caring. You'll enjoy working together with the rest of the team so we all learn from each other, especially in such a rapidly changing space.
Be ambitious. You’ll need a startup mentality, and will revel in rapidly pivot between different projects, priorities and contexts. 
Be flexible. Products and priorities will change, so it's vital that you enjoy change and you're willing to experience new ways of thinking. 
Sense of humour is a definite plus!

What we offer:
Be part of our journey to disrupt the $3b+ blockchain supply chain market
An opportunity to expand your portfolio into designing a blockchain enabled product
You will be one of the earliest member of the design team hence, you will have the option to lead future platform development as we go along in our journey.
